newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot resid prices steady again, demand thin.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot resid prices steady again, demand thin.

text.p: U.S. spot residual fuel prices again held relatively steady Friday, but trade remained thin and some expected weak utility demand and softer crude to soon pressure the complex, industry sources said.

"The market has been very thin, but we normally see a selloff in September and October as demand falls off," said one cash trader, adding cheap gas prices continued to siphon utility demand from resid.
In New York Harbor, prompt one percent was unchanged at $17.50 a barrel, while September one percent paper slipped 10 cents or more to $17.00-20 with crude, traders said.
NYH 0.3 percent high pour notionally was steady at $19.75-20.00 but increased supply expected next month from Africa could pressure the grade, traders said.
At the U.S. Gulf Coast, one percent was still at $16.50-75, while three percent held around $14.75.
No NYH or USG deals were reported.
New York city gate weekend gas prices fell several cents Friday to below $2.20/mmBtu versus NYH one percent resid at a $2.77/mmBtu equivalent.
